mapper.insert: insert into test1 (ID, username, password, sex, city, sign, experience, score, classify, wealth, CREATE_TIME, UPDATE_TIME) values (#{id,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{username,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{password,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{sex,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{city,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{sign,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{experience,jdbcType=DECIMAL}, #{score,jdbcType=DECIMAL}, #{classify,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{wealth,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{createTime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, #{updateTime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP})
mapper.update: update test1 set username = #{username,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, password = #{password,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, sex = #{sex,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, city = #{city,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, sign = #{sign,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, experience = #{experience,jdbcType=DECIMAL}, score = #{score,jdbcType=DECIMAL}, classify = #{classify,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, wealth = #{wealth,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, CREATE_TIME = #{createTime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, UPDATE_TIME = #{updateTime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP} where ID = #{id,jdbcType=VARCHAR}
mapper.select: select ID, username, password, sex, city, sign, experience, score, classify, wealth, CREATE_TIME, UPDATE_TIME from test1 where ID = #{id,jdbcType=VARCHAR}
select ID, username, password, sex, city, sign, experience, score, classify, wealth, CREATE_TIME, UPDATE_TIME from test1

select count(1) from test1
AND id = #{id}
AND username like '%' #{keyWord} '%'
AND sign like '%' #{keyWord} '%'
select password from test1 where username=#{username}
